title: Relapse of polymyalgia rheumatica after a fall
patient: An 82-year-old Caucasian woman in PMR remission with 2.5 mg of prednisone on alternate days, the night after having suffered a distorted trauma to the left knee, was unable to get out of bed to go to the bathroom and had to be helped by her daughter. The next morning, when we visited her, despite having taken an analgesic tablet in addition to 2.5 mg of prednisone, no improvement was recorded. The left knee was not swollen. The patient’s PMR-AS score was 84. After five days of therapy with 10 mg/day of prednisone, PMR-AS was reduced to 9.
